text:
East River, Queens shore, showing two views of College Point. View 1 shows the thickly wooded Chisholm Point, owned by the Chisholms and later converted into College Point Park. In the foreground is the area south of the Point and the Knickerbocker Yacht Club dock, at the foot of Third Street, later 112th Street. View 2 shows the steamboat Isabel, docked at the Point of View Pier at Tallmans Island, also known as Point of View Island. This island was separated from the mainland by Morris Creek, named after Morris, the island's owner in 1873. Subsequently it was owned by Charles Julius Freygang and after him by Joseph Wetzel, who took over the property in 1892.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
1897
Views 1,2
title: East River - Queens shore - College Point.

text:
Chisholm's Point. Apr. 2, 1928
C. Manley DeBevoise, photographer.
title: Queens: Chisholm's Point.

folder: College Point & [14th Avenue & Chisholm Point.], Queens, NY
text:
Two views of College Point, view 1 showing the ferry slips of the Clason Point (Bronx) ferry and a casino and dancing pavilion directly to the left of them. The ferry slips are at the foot of 14th Avenue. View 2 shows Chisholm Point and the Chisholm Mansion. The area later became College Point Park.

View 1: Aug. 5, 1935
View 2: March 12, 1932

P. L. Sperr, photographer
title: Queens: College Point - [14th Avenue - Chisholm Point.]

folder: College Point Park & [Chisholm Mansion.], Queens, NY
text:
College Point Park (Queens): The Chisholm Mansion, built in 1848. It was used as the Summer City Hall in 1937 by Mayor LaGuardia. For additional data see "The New York Times," March 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr

March 12, 1932
Views 1,2,3
title: Queens: College Point Park - [Chisholm Mansion.]

folder: College Point - [College Point Life Guards.], Queens, NY
text:
"East River, Queens shore," showing views of College Point Park, the former Chisholm estate. The College Point Life Guards' cabin is at the foot of Poppenhusen Avenue, near old ferry slips. In the background (view 1) is Clason Point, the Bronx.

P. L. Sperr

View 1: March 12, 1932
Views 2,3: August 5, 1935
title: East River - Queens shore - College Point - [College Point Life Guards.]
